briefTitle: Community Servings: Food as Medicine for Diabetes
officialTitle: Community Servings: Food as Medicine for Diabetes

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* • Diagnosis of type 2 diabetes

  * Age 18 years or older
  * HbA1c level \>8.0%
  * Report food insecurity as indicated by the 2-item USDA Food Security Survey Module13
  * Willing to commit to random assignment to either receive CS meals immediately or as a waitlist control
  * Stable health, with no severe medical comorbidities that might interfere with their ability to participate in the intervention, such as severe psychiatric illness or imminent hospitalization
  * Be willing to keep a food diary
  * Be willing to attend and complete a baseline, 12 week, and 24 week assessment at MGH
  * Be able to understand and communicate effectively in English
  * Have a primary care physician within the MGH practice based research network
  * Live in an area where Community Servings can deliver meals
  * Ability to store and prepare Community Servings meals

Exclusion Criteria:

* • Must not be pregnant or planning pregnancy in the next year

  * Currently enrolled in another diabetes study Food allergy that would prohibit consumption of meals
  * Receiving episodic treatments that may increase blood glucose levels (e.g. prednisone)

primary.description: Calculated using data from ASA24 24-hour dietary recall tool Healthy Eating Index 2010 Score Minimum and Maximum range = 0 to 100 Higher scores indicate better diet quality The score is an average of the three-time periods that data was collected
primary.timeFrame: Average of 3 24-hour food recalls per study period (on and off meals; one in-person visit and 2 over the phone at 4 and 8 weeks into the study)

secondary.measure: Number of Participants With Food Insecurity
secondary.description: Food insecurity is defined as \> 2 affirmative responses on the 10 adult referenced items USDA Household Food Security Survey Module
secondary.timeFrame: Measured at end of On-Meals Period and end of Off-Meals Period for each participant

secondary.description: Diabetes Distress calculated using the Diabetes Distress Scale Minimum and Maximum scores range of the scale is 17-106 For this measure the lower the score the better
secondary.timeFrame: Measured at end of On-Meals Period and end of Off-Meals Period for each participant

other.description: This will be measured using a fasting blood draw at baseline, 12 and 24 weeks
other.timeFrame: Measured at end of On-Meals Period and end of Off-Meals Period for each participant

other.description: A fasting blood draw will be used to measure: LDL Cholesterol
other.timeFrame: Measured at end of On-Meals Period and end of Off-Meals Period for each participant

other.description:
Body Mass Index will be measured in light street clothes (without shoes) using a single calibrated scale.

Height measured using a stadiometer. Body Mass Index (BMI) is a person's weight in kilograms divided by the square of height in meters.

A high BMI can be an indicator of high body fatness.
other.timeFrame: Measured at end of On-Meals Period and end of Off-Meals Period for each participant

other.description: Measured using a calibrated sphygmomanometer with appropriate cuff sizes based on arm circumference. Average of 2 readings, first manual and second automated at 1 min intervals following a 5 min period of rest.
other.timeFrame: Measured at end of On-Meals Period and end of Off-Meals Period for each participant using a calibrated sphygmomanometer

other.description: Measured using a calibrated sphygmomanometer with appropriate cuff sizes based on arm circumference. Average of 2 readings, first manual and second automated at 1 min intervals following a 5 min period of rest.
other.timeFrame: Measured at end of On-Meals Period and end of Off-Meals Period for each participant using a calibrated sphygmomanometer

other.measure: Change From Baseline in Medication Adherence
other.description: Change from baseline in Medication Adherence Rating Scale (Assessed using medication adherence rating scale) Range is 0-25 The higher the number the better
other.timeFrame: Measured at end of On-Meals Period and end of Off-Meals Period for each participant

other.measure: Number of Participants With Cost Related Medication Under-Use
other.description: Cost Related Medication Under-use (Defined as \> 0 affirmative responses to 4-items on cost-related medication under-use from the medication expenditure panel survey)
other.timeFrame: Measured at end of On-Meals Period and end of Off-Meals Period for each participant

other.measure: Number of Participants With Food and Medication Trade-offs
other.description: Prevalence of food and medication trade-offs between groups
other.timeFrame: Measured at end of On-Meals Period and end of Off-Meals Period for each participant

other.measure: Depressive Symptoms (Assessed Using the PHQ-8 Scale)
other.description: Patient Health Questionnaire - 8 item version. The score ranges 0-24, The lower score represents less depressive symptoms
other.timeFrame: Measured at end of On-Meals Period and end of Off-Meals Period for each participant

other.measure: Change From Baseline in Cognitive Burden (Assessed Using Times on the Stroop Task)
other.description: This outcome was planned to be measured but not measured owing to technical difficulties in assessment
other.timeFrame: Measured at end of On-Meals Period and end of Off-Meals Period for each participant

other.measure: Number of Participants With Self-reported Hypoglycemia
other.description: Report of hypoglycemia requiring assistance in last 3 months
other.timeFrame: Measured at end of On-Meals Period and end of Off-Meals Period for each participant

other.description: A fasting blood draw will be used to measure: Triglycerides
other.timeFrame: Measured at end of On-Meals Period and end of Off-Meals Period for each participant by fasting blood draw

other.description: A fasting blood draw will be used to measure: HDL Cholesterol
other.timeFrame: Measured at end of On-Meals Period and end of Off-Meals Period for each participant by fasting blood draw

other.description: A fasting blood draw will be used to measure: Total Cholesterol
other.timeFrame: Measured at end of On-Meals Period and end of Off-Meals Period for each participant by fasting blood draw
